info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 4:10AM CST until March 05 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SHERMAN COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SHERMAN COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM CST this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Sherman. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph today. Southwest to west winds 25 to 30 mph with gusts to 45 mph on Saturday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 22 percent today and as low as 12 percent on Saturday. * Red Flag Threat Index...1 to 2 today and 3 to 4 on Saturday. * Timing...Noon until 7 pm today and 10 am until 7 pm on Saturday.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
